results.title: The Case of the travelling garden
results.creator_credit: Raymond Leach, Joe Scully and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: The Department of Customs checks on all plants being brought into Australia and administers agricultural quarantine regulations. Travellers are required to leave behind all fruit and vegetables, flowers and bulbs for these may be disease-carrying. Australia is fortunate in having so much agriculture which is free from any overseas pests and diseases. Uses animation. (For the Plant Quarantine Publicity Campaign, 1972).
results.creator_credit_for_label: Raymond Leach, Joe Scully and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit

results.title: The Case of the missing chickows: adding positive and negati
results.brief_description: Presents the mysterious didappearance of curious creatures called chickcows to introduce students to pairing as a procedure for adding positive and negative integers. Story by E.D. Bogas and Mitch Rose. Animation by Mitch Rose. Suitable for upper primary level.

results.title: The Case of the cosmic comic
results.creator_credit: Gary Templeton, Morton Schindel and Weston Woods Studios
results.brief_description: Homer Price’s good friend Freddy is a true-blue hero worshipper whose idol is the azure-caped Super-Duper. After meeting the super-human hero in person at the Centerburg movie theatre, the boys encounter him again - only this time the Super-Duper is badly in need of their assistance. From the book “Homer Price” by Robert McCloskey.

results.title: The Carp
results.creator_credit: Maxwell Munden and Max Munden Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Anglers’ Corner”.
One of a series of films on inland water fishing in England, introduced by Bernard Venables. Shows Leslie Brewer bottom fishing for carp in a Dorset lake early one summer morning. Gives facts about the fish, where it feeds and where to find it, tackle and bait used, and how to play the catch.

results.title: The Car man: Pininfarina
results.creator_credit: Denis Postle, Anthony de Lotbinière and BBC-TV
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Pacemakers”.
Pininfarina, the world’s greatest name in automobile design, founder of a firm which builds 25,000 car bodies a year, and designs many others. Farina has used his uncanny feeling for the look and shape of cars to build a unique industry - an industry which is ideally suited to a comparatively small industrial nation like Italy, and which has given her a reputation unequalled in the world. Commentary written and spoken by Anthony Jay.

results.title: The Campaign
results.creator_credit: Santo Cilauro, Debra Choate, ABC-TV (Australia) and Frontline Television Productions
results.brief_description: The Campaign is a surprising political documentary where the anatomy of a federal campaign has been laid bare: the logistics, the travelling, the locations, the surroundings and the schedule. For the full 35 days of the 1996 Federal Election campaign, Santo Cilauro and his video-camera followed the then Prime Minister Paul Keating, his entourage and the media pack, around Australia to give a revealing insight into the physical nature of campaigning for the nation’s highest office. An inside view of how our view is formed in an era where the election battle is fought with the 15 second grab, this two part program is a dynamic display of how the moment is manufactured. Covering 35 days, 150 journalists, 40,000km, 11 million voters and one man in the middle, The Campaign shows why people describe Australian elections like no other in the world.

results.title: The Camera and the tripod
results.creator_credit: Lynn John, John A. Givins and KTV Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Video tech”.
This episode deals with what the camera sees - focus and shot sizes, how to make pictures look better and how to zoom, pan and tilt.

results.title: The Camera
results.creator_credit: Sandra Ostertag, CBS, Coast Community Colleges, Holt, Rinehart and Winston and KOCE-TV (Television station : Huntington Beach, Calif.)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “The Photographic vision”.
Photographic artist and educator Mark Johnstone uses a view camera to demonstrate and describe basic features common to all cameras. Illustrates the advantages and disadvantages of various types of cameras. Guest photographers explain how their particular cameras are ideal for their types of photography.
